description: Students focus on the nursing care of childbearing and childrearing families
in the context of family-centered care.  Family theory will be utilized as the
framework for nursing assessment and care of families in various situations
across the lifespan.  Clinical experiences are provided with childbearing and
childrearing families.  Offered annually in the fall semester. Prerequisites: open to senior
with grades of C or above; concurrent enrollment in NURS 315 and NURS 316.
